name: Holiday Inn Express Bismarck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights in August, 2008 at the Holiday Inn Express in Bismarck, N.D. We had a very comfortable and relaxing stay. Our room was very spacious, clean and well-arranged. As usual, the bed was above average for comfort, as we've found every time with the Holiday Inn Express chain. The pillows are great and there are lots of them. The bathroom was spacious and the shower has a great curved rod to keep all drafts out. The water pressure was a little lacking, but not terrible. The air conditioning unit was a bit noisy, but not even close to the horrible ones in the Minot Holiday Inn Express. This one was noticable, but not unbearable. Our only negative was the continental breakfast. The orange juice machine ran out. The coffee was barely coffee, more like hot water, no whole wheat or grain bagels, only white, the cinnamon rolls were rock hard and cold, with no way to warm them, and only bananas as a choice of fruit. Very poor for a continental!! We liked the hotel very much though, and will definitely stay there again.....but we will go to a restaurant for breakfast.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

likes.liked: — Very clean, very comfortable beds and very spacious rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at this Holiday Inn
reviews.title: I'd stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Express for one night while traveling to a family reunion. I was happily surprised how nice it was. The room was clean and up-to-date with a huge plasma TV. The free breakfast was great as well. Unlike some reviewers, our experience with the staff was good. I found everyone there to be friendly and helpful. Our GPS system could not locate this hotel for some reason but the hotel staff directed us easily. If this is what all Holiday Inn Express are like, I am going to give up on higher price hotels and try them next time.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, nice linens and great plasma tv

reviews.text: Located in busy shopping area. Numerous eating establishments nearby, Nice pool and exercise facilities, friendly staff
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

description: Bismarck's newest and finest hotel is the Bismarck Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites. The Bismarck Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is conveniently located off of I-94 and Exit 159. The hotel offers upscale accommodations that fit all travelers needs. This beautiful hotel is close to the State Capitol, Missouri River, Kirkwood Mall, Bismarck State University, University of Mary, and many Restaurants within a 3 mile radius. Offers 74 Spacious Guestrooms that include Suites and Executive Rooms. Special in room amenities are free high speed internet and Pay Per View Movies. Hotel features include 42 inch flat screen LCD TV's in each guest room, complimentary deluxe Stay Smart Breakfast, Fitness Center, Indoor Pool, and Whirlpool, Business Center with computers and free high speed internet, Board Room, Meeting Room, and Free Morning Paper and local phone calls. BUSINESS: Unisys Corporation, Med Center One, Basin Electric, US Healthcare and St Alexius Hospital. UNIVERSITIES: Bismarck State University, University of Mary Local Attractions are Custer House, Fort Lincoln, Missouri River, State Historical Museum, Raging River Water Park, Dakota Zoo, Lewis & Clark Riverboat, and Prairie Knights Casino.
